content.description: Quite possibly much harder than the rating indicates.  To the right of Crack Smack.  Last route to the right on the wall.  Climb up over the outcropping to the first bolt.  Many small crimps and very small lie-backs.  Two variations:  one to the left and the other to the right.  Finish on steep terrain to chains.
content.protection: Bolts and chains at the top
content.location: All the way to the right on Mai Tai Wall

content.description:
After clipping the first bolt, mantle up awkwardly onto the face. Move up following the seam, climbing mostly to the left. Some nice holds lead up through the face and slab right up to the top of the cliff. 

  A nice easier route that is not quite as greasy as some of the more popular easy warm-ups. It's a little weird getting onto the ledge and maybe as hard as the route. 

  Beware of poison ivy growing up the wall between the ground and the ledge below and to the right of the route.
content.location: This is the second route from the left end of the wall. From Prototype wall walk about 100 feet along below a roof to where the ledge sticks out. There are 2 routes that start off of the ledge, this is the right one and starts by standing on the cut off stump of the "Tree" that is no longer there.

content.description: Five feet to the right of "Tree".  Typical mixture of large and small limestone holds very similar to "Tree".  Steep route.  First bolt is 12 feet up.  Large shelf/cave 5 feet below the anchors with variety of options for holds inside as you transition up the face again with one hand or the other.  The top of the wall has several spots to hang from while you build an anchor from two chains.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  Two chains hanging at the top
content.location: Mai Tai Wall about 5 feet to the right of "Tree".  Mai Tai wall is to the right of Prototype Wall and before Insect Wall

content.description: Description by John Hogge from Austin Climbing.  "Bolt 1 is over the rightmost end of the roof that's under Prototype Wall routes Bongo Fury and The ReKleiner.  Start by dynoing from the ground to a block 3 feet left of Bolt 1.  Bolts 2 and 3 slant slightly left.  Easy runout to Bolt 3.  Runout to the anchors over a bad slab fall."
content.location: All the way to the left on Mai Tai Wall.  To the left of "Tree"

content.description: Very similar to the two routes to the left of it.  4 bolts to the top passing through areas of large and small holds.  Ledge near the top with holds in back.
content.location: Mai Tai Wall to the right of Tree and Mega Lounge

content.description: To the right of Let the Wallies Loose. To start off, there are some kind of overhung boulder moves that require a very beta specific sequence to get over the bulge.  Once over the bulge, the rest of the route is similar to the routes to the left of it but with thinner holds at the shelf area before the chains.  Great route.
content.location: To the Right of Let the Wallies Loose

content.description: Climbs a lieback "crack." First bolt is kind of high but the climbing is pretty easy to it.  Wandering very thin face moves which require very specific balancing combined with friction and body position towards the top. First go the right and then back to left and then slightly back to the right again and up to the chains.  Clip bolts only when on "good" holds.
content.protection: Bolts with chains at the top
content.location: To the right of I Speak for the Trees.  Almost to the end of the wall.

content.description: This wall is the first wall to the right of the Prototype wall.  This contains a small collection of moderate routes.  This is a good place for you to bring your newbie friend if Eight Flake is occupied (as it probably will be).  For these routes, you will want to belay from the ledge.  Watch out for poison ivy in the spring and summer.
